page.title: 12Transport
page.content: Todmorden is linked to the outside world by 3 main roads:the A646(T)runs north-west to Burnley,9 miles away,and east to Halifax,12 miles away;the A6033 runs south to Rochdale,9 miles away and is joined by the A681 which links Todmorden to Bacup, 6 miles to the west. Todmorden has a railway station and is on the main line from Manchester to Leeds.This line was temporarily closed in 1985, after a tanker train was partially derailed in Summit tunnel, which is nearly 2 miles long.The fire, which lasted for several days, caused a great deal of damage. The Rochdale Canal, which flows through the centre of Todmorden, joins the Bridgewater Canal at Rochdale and the Calder and Hebble Navigation near Halifax.It is hoped that in the future it can be reopened to attract tourism.
